sentences.en: Andr é Wallenberg was the financier of Sweden's industrialisation.
sentences.cn: 安德?瓦伦堡是瑞典工业化的融资者.

sentences.en: Brazil has benefited hugely from China's industrialisation.
sentences.cn: 巴西因中国工业化而受益极大.

sentences.en: But the size and scale of industrialisation and urbanisation in China are unprecedented.
sentences.cn: 但是,中国工业化和城市化的规模和幅度都是前所未有的.

sentences.en: By the 1920 s architects throughout Europe were reacting against the conditions created by industrialisation.
sentences.cn: 19世纪20年代,遍及欧洲的建筑师反抗工业化带来的环境.

sentences.en: It points to the onset of industrialisation and rising greenhouse gas emissions as the cause of the trend.
sentences.cn: 论文指出，工业化的开始和不断增长的温室气体排放是造成这种趋势的原因。

sentences.en: Soviet advisers arrived in force after 1944 to make sure that the newly communist country did not stray from the course of nationalisation, industrialisation and building socialism.
sentences.cn: 苏联顾问在1944年来到保加利亚，为了确认这个新的社会主义国家没有背离国有化、工业化和社会主义化的进程。

sentences.en: The synthesis ofp - Phenylenediamine was summarized and its route of industrialisation was discussed.
sentences.cn: 归纳了对苯二胺的各种制备方法,并讨论了其工业化的优劣.

sentences.en: This massive overbuild is being colossal scale of industrialisation.
sentences.cn: 大规模的工业化正在造成这种过度累积.

sentences.en: Untrammelled industrialisation, particularly in poor countries, is contaminating rivers and aquifers.
sentences.cn: 不节制的工业化, 尤其是在穷国, 正在污染河流和地下含水层们.
